headline: The global M&A boom is rolling into 2026 as AI sparks deal frenzy — but cash is getting tight
summary: Markets are betting that the global M&A surge has not yet finished, as Wall Street recovered its appetite for large-scale financings.

headline: Jamie Dimon Warns of ‘Dumb Stuff’ Risks. Private Credit Could Be Where They Are.
summary: The problem with trying to heed a warning from the nation’s most important banker, who is worried about rivals doing “dumb stuff” reminiscent of the 2008-2009 financial crisis, is that the stuff in question is really hard to see.  JPMorgan Chase  CEO Jamie Dimon, the personification of Wall Street’s early warning system, told an investor event in New York on Monday that “there’s always a surprise in a credit cycle” that can escalate into a larger financial crisis.  The $3 trillion private-credit market is the latest corner of the global financial system to be caught up in the downdraft of selling tied to the artificial-intelligence investment trade.

headline: How The Blackstone (BX) Story Is Shifting As Analysts Reset Valuation Expectations
summary: Blackstone’s updated fair value estimate has been trimmed from US$171.00 to about US$166.72, a roughly 2.5% move that lines up more closely with recent price target resets across the Street. Behind that change, analysts are tightening their views on what investors may be willing to pay, balancing expectations around realizations, credit performance, and ongoing deal activity. As you read on, you will see how these shifting targets feed into the broader narrative and what to watch to stay on...
